initialResponse.question: You're a customer service representative. A customer calls in, sounding quite upset, and tells you they've received a defective product. 'Hello, I recently ordered a product from your company and it's defective! This is unacceptable!'

options.text: I'm sorry, but it's not my fault.
Can you please clarify what you mean by 'defective'?
I apologize for the inconvenience. Let's find a solution together.
You must have used it incorrectly.

addressingEmotion.question: 'I've always trusted your brand, and now I feel disappointed. I needed this for a special event tomorrow!'

options.text: Many customers buy our products without issues. Maybe you're just unlucky.
I understand your frustration and disappointment. Let's see how we can rectify this in time for your event.
Why didn't you check it as soon as you received it?
We can give you a 10% discount on your next purchase.

proposedSolution.question: 'What can you do about this? I don't have time to send this back and wait for a replacement.'

options.text: Well, all sales are final. Sorry!
You can buy another one, and we'll refund you when we receive the defective one.
I can arrange for an expedited delivery of a replacement product. Additionally, you can return the defective one at your convenience.
That's not my problem.

handlingNegativePublicity.question: 'I've told my friends about this issue, and they're advising me to post about it on social media. I really didn't expect this from your brand.'

options.text: You can post whatever you want. We have many satisfied customers.
I'm really sorry you feel that way. Let's work together to resolve this. We value your feedback and want to ensure your satisfaction.
If you post negatively, we'll have to ban you from making future purchases.
There's no need to involve others. Can you please keep this between us?

futureTrustAssurance.question: 'How do I know I won't face the same issue in the future? I'm losing my trust in your company.'

options.text: Mistakes happen. You just got unlucky.
Our products generally have high reviews. Don't worry about it.
I understand your concerns. We continually strive to improve our product quality, and your feedback is crucial. I'll ensure this is escalated to our quality control team.
Maybe our products are just not suitable for you.
